description: From Italian stanza, from Vulgar Latin *stantia (“standing, stopping-place”), from Latin stāns, stantis, from stō, stāre, from Proto-Italic *staēō, from Proto-Indo-European *sth₂éh₁yeti, stative verb from *steh₂- (whence English stand). Doublet of stance.

entries.meaning: A unit of a poem, written or printed as a paragraph; equivalent to a verse.
(architecture) An apartment or division in a building.
(computing) An XML element which acts as basic unit of meaning in XMPP.
examples: Definition of XML Stanza: An XML stanza is the basic unit of meaning in XMPP.

entries.meaning: (broadcasting) A segment; a portion of a broadcast devoted to a particular topic.
(sports) A period; an interval into which a sporting event is divided.
